description: A Frappe Framework instance can function as an OAuth Client, Resource, or Authorization server. This DocType contains settings related to all three.

fields.description: These fields are used to provide resource server metadata to clients querying the "well known protected resource" end point.
fields.label: Metadata

fields.description: Human-readable name intended for display to the end user.
fields.label: Resource Name

fields.description: URL of a human-readable page with info that developers might need.
fields.label: Resource Documentation

fields.description: URL of human-readable page with info on requirements about how the client can use the data.
fields.label: Resource Policy URI

fields.description: URL of human-readable page with info about the protected resource's terms of service.
fields.label: Resource TOS URI

fields.description: Allows clients to fetch metadata from the /.well-known/oauth-authorization-server endpoint. Reference: RFC8414
fields.label: Show Auth Server Metadata

fields.description: Allows clients to fetch metadata from the /.well-known/oauth-protected-resource endpoint. Reference: RFC9728
fields.label: Show Protected Resource Metadata

fields.description: New line separated list of scope values.
fields.label: Scopes Supported

fields.description: Allows clients to register themselves without manual intervention. Registration creates a OAuth Client entry. Reference: RFC7591
fields.label: Enable Dynamic Client Registration

fields.description: Allows skipping authorization if a user has active tokens.
fields.label: Skip Authorization

fields.description: Allows enabled Social Login Key Base URL to be shown as authorization server.
fields.label: Show Social Login Key as Authorization Server

fields.description:
New line separated list of allowed public client URLs (eg https://frappe.io), or * to accept all.
Public clients are restricted by default.
fields.label: Allowed Public Client Origins

name: OAuth Settings
